types.name: National Cemetery
types.description: National cemeteries are burial grounds maintained by the federal government, primarily for military veterans and their dependents.

types.name: Veterans Cemetery
types.description: State-run cemeteries honoring military veterans who served our nation.

types.name: Memorial Park
types.description: Beautifully landscaped cemeteries with park-like settings and flat markers.

types.name: Natural Burial Ground
types.description: Eco-friendly burial sites that allow for natural decomposition and conservation.

types.name: Green Cemetery
types.description: Environmentally sustainable cemeteries focused on natural preservation.

types.name: Catholic Cemetery
types.description: Cemeteries operated by or affiliated with the Catholic Church.

types.name: Jewish Cemetery
types.description: Traditional Jewish burial grounds following Jewish law and customs.

types.name: Muslim Cemetery
types.description: Islamic cemeteries following Muslim burial traditions and facing Mecca.

types.name: Baptist Cemetery
types.description: Burial grounds associated with Baptist churches and congregations.

types.name: Methodist Cemetery
types.description: Cemeteries affiliated with Methodist churches.

types.name: Lutheran Cemetery
types.description: Burial grounds associated with Lutheran congregations.

types.name: Presbyterian Cemetery
types.description: Cemeteries maintained by Presbyterian churches.

types.name: Episcopal Cemetery
types.description: Anglican/Episcopal church burial grounds.

types.name: Orthodox Cemetery
types.description: Eastern Orthodox Christian cemeteries.

types.name: Historic Cemetery
types.description: Historically significant cemeteries often listed on national or state registers.

types.name: Pioneer Cemetery
types.description: Early American settlement burial grounds from frontier times.

types.name: Civil War Cemetery
types.description: Cemeteries containing graves of Civil War soldiers.

types.name: Family Cemetery
types.description: Private burial grounds on family property.

types.name: Community Cemetery
types.description: Non-denominational cemeteries serving local communities.

types.name: Municipal Cemetery
types.description: City or town-operated public cemeteries.

types.name: County Cemetery
types.description: Cemeteries maintained by county governments.

types.name: Crematorium
types.description: Facilities offering cremation services, often with columbarium niches.

types.name: Mausoleum
types.description: Above-ground tomb structures for entombment.

types.name: Columbarium
types.description: Structures with niches for storing cremated remains.

types.name: Pet Cemetery
types.description: Cemeteries dedicated to the burial of pets and animals.

types.name: African American Cemetery
types.description: Historically significant burial grounds for African American communities.

types.name: Native American Cemetery
types.description: Sacred burial grounds of Indigenous peoples.

types.name: Chinese Cemetery
types.description: Cemeteries serving Chinese-American communities.

types.name: Masonic Cemetery
types.description: Cemeteries affiliated with Freemason lodges.

types.name: Fraternal Cemetery
types.description: Burial grounds operated by fraternal organizations.

types.name: Sailors Cemetery
types.description: Cemeteries for merchant sailors and naval personnel.

types.name: Garden Cemetery
types.description: Victorian-era cemeteries designed as landscaped parks.
